pullRequest.title: Add metadata support for reading hive encrypted data
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds metadata support #14621. Adds the constructs to pass encryption information to HiveSplit and also the table properties needed to define encryption settings for a table.
Encryption metadata support for writing data to Hive will add in an upcoming PR.
== RELEASE NOTES ==

Hive Changes
* Add support for reading Hive tables with DWRF encryption at rest.

depended by facebookexternal/presto-facebook#1040

beforeCommit.message:
DDL support for DWRF encryption

Introduced the following table properties:

1. `encrypt_table` - keyReference for the whole table
2. `encrypt_columns` - keyReference for specific columns
3. `dwrf_encryption_provider`
4. `dwrf_encryption_algorithm`

`encrypt_table` and `encrypt_columns` can be used by other file formats as well.

These settings are serialized and stored in table parameters of the Hive table.

nodes.bodyText: This should be changed to a fieldReference https://github.com/prestodb/presto/pull/14621/files#diff-bbdd3443793c8f1846fcec59930191df.  But if you want it can be changed later so there's no dependency between the PRs.

commit.message:
Pass requested columns to HiveTableLayoutHandle

This is needed for encryption at rest work so that we can fetch the keys for the appropriate columns only in the coordinator

Base classes for passing encryption information to `HiveSplit`

Introducing basic constructs for fetching and passing encryption information to HiveSplit.

`HiveEncryptionInformationProvider` loops over available `EncryptionInformationSource` to
wait for the first one to return `EncryptionInformation`. `EncryptionInformation` contains
member variables which contains information about the different encryption formats.
Currently only `DWRF` encryption is supported and hence it is the only member variable in it.

DDL support for DWRF encryption

Introduced the following table properties:

1. `encrypt_table` - keyReference for the whole table
2. `encrypt_columns` - keyReference for specific columns
3. `dwrf_encryption_provider`
4. `dwrf_encryption_algorithm`

`encrypt_table` and `encrypt_columns` can be used by other file formats as well.

These settings are serialized and stored in table parameters of the Hive table.
